ygData.subject: RE: Re: Archmage Answers
ygData.msgSnippet: That s the funny part, no not really.  I guess I just have gotten tired of being lied to by Verant.  Oh yes we test thoroughly, even for bards  Yet, it takes
ygData.messageBody:
That's the funny part, no not really. I guess I just have gotten tired of
being lied to by Verant. "Oh yes we test thoroughly, even for bards" Yet,
it takes not 2 minutes to prove that the change they put in for Sonorous
Clouding does not work. How can the person who is supposed to be the font
of all knowledge for spells not know how they work? And if he doesn't, why
didn't he bother to take the time to find out? Its not like this was an off
the cuff post to a board at random.

I mean seriously. What purpose is served by answering our questions if they
don't take the time to give the correct answers? If all they do is tell us
how something is supposed to work without ever bothering to check and see if
maybe they made a mistake and it doesn't work the way they think it does,
what good does it do? Its not like this is an isolated incident. If any
other entertainment venture repeatedly insulted your intelligence, lied to
you, and refused to address mistakes, would you still support it? I doubt
it. The NFL is a good example. The NFL is pretty cool entertainment-wise.
Would I think so if my representative team was the Cincinnati Bengals? No,
I wouldn't be interested any more then either.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Joshua R. Moore [mailto:josh@...]
Sent: Friday, February 04, 2000 10:35 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Archmage Answers


From: "Joshua R. Moore" <josh@...>

You really are a "Glass is half empty" kind of person, eh? =P

-----Original Message-----
From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:Dean_Kimes@...]
Sent: Friday, February 04, 2000 12:23 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Archmage Answers


From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>

>From: "Robin Wise 3" <eurmali@...>
> Q: What is the specific impact wielding a flute has on each of the
> following: Cinda's Charismatic Carillon, Tarew's Aquatic Ayre,
> Solon's Song of the Sirens, Crission's Pixie Strike, and Agilmente's
> Aria of Eagles?
>
> A: Greater Faction increase, none, none, Lowers more Magic Resistance,
> none.

>I was glad to see it too - that was one of many questions I submitted. = )

Yes, too bad its incorrect. Wind instruments have no effect on the MR
Debuff of Pixie Strike. This is a fact known by anyone who has sung Pixie
with a flute equipped. Obviously this group does not include any Verant
employees.

Kit
